item.title: Covid: Ministers wait to hear if they face quarantine after Javid tests positive
item.description: Health Secretary Sajid Javid, who has tested positive for Covid, is isolating and working from home.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine offered to all UK adults, says government
item.description: More than two-thirds of people have had both doses as England prepares for rules to ease on Monday.

item.title: Europe floods: Victims face massive clean-up as waters recede
item.description: Residents of the worst-affected areas struggle to recover from the devastation as flood waters recede.

item.title: Long Covid funding to unearth new treatments
item.description: Researchers from across the UK will investigate everything from brain fog to ongoing breathlessness.

item.title: Haiti: Wife of assassinated president returns from US after surviving attack
item.description: Wearing a bulletproof vest, Martine MoÃ¯se flew back from the US after being wounded in the attack.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins top Palme d'Or prize
item.description: The outlandish Titane wins after jury president Spike Lee reveals the award in a ceremony slip-up.

item.title: Moment New York mum saves five-year-old from kidnap
item.description: The mother pulled her son from a car after he was taken from her in broad daylight in the New York City.

item.title: 'Havana syndrome'-like mystery illness affects Vienna US diplomats
item.description: The Biden administration is investigating cases of "Havana syndrome" among US officials.

item.title: Daughter of Afghan envoy kidnapped and injured in Pakistan
item.description: Afghan officials urge Pakistan to keep diplomats safe, amid tensions between the two neighbours.

item.title: Canada's vaccination rate overtakes US
item.description: Canada had a slow start on vaccinations compared to its neighbour but has now caught up to the US.

item.title: Covid: London's Metropolitan Line closed after staff pinged by NHS app
item.description: Control room staff on the Metropolitan Line are isolating after being sent alerts by the NHS app.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: 'Heartless' quarantine decision to be re-examined
item.description: Laura Soutar is stuck in hotel isolation in Majorca while her father Iain, from Milngavie, has just days to live.

item.title: The Open 2021: Louis Oosthuizen takes one-stroke lead into final day
item.description: Louis Oosthuizen takes a one-stroke lead into the final day of The Open at Royal St George's after holding off Collin Morikawa.

item.title: The Papers: 'Freedumb day' and 'No 10 pingdemic'
item.description: The front pages focus on the growing criticism facing the government over Monday's easing of Covid rules in England.

item.title: Covid-19 tests while you wait in Israeli airport
item.description: Ben Gurion airport in Israel has introduced fast Covid-19 tests for travellers.

item.title: Joshi is swapping life in captivity for a new start in the jungle
item.description: After a lifetime in captivity, Joshi is going to live in the jungle in Congo-Brazzaville.

item.title: TikTok: Dog training tips from 'small-town Essex boy'
item.description: Adam's videos on looking after dogs have attracted more than a million followers during lockdown.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'under the stars'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Farne Islands: Puffins see visitors return after 18 months
item.description: Tourists haven't been able to go to the Farne Islands for 18 months and it's changed the birds' behaviour.

item.title: The Broadway dancer whose lockdown business bloomed
item.description: When Covid closed New York theatres, dancer Robbie Fairchild started a business that put down roots.

item.title: 'Working in Mum's care home brought us closer'
item.description: Lydia Loader, whose mother Sally has dementia, heard her speak for the first time in 18 months.

item.title: Why was my tweet about football labelled abusive?
item.description: A BBC journalist sets out to discover how Twitter moderates posts after he was banned from the platform.

item.title: Coventry City of Culture: The women who helped shape a 'city of justice'
item.description: Coventry women have always been at the heart of the struggle for social justice, a historian says.

item.title: British Grand Prix: 'F1 breaks new ground but jury still out on sprint qualifying'
item.description: F1 broke new ground with the advent of sprint qualifying but uncertainty remains over whether the exercise was a success, writes Andrew Benson.

item.title: Abir Moussi: The Tunisian MP who was slapped but not beaten
item.description: Abir Moussi uses a megaphone in parliament and gets death threats but many say her voice is crucial.

item.title: In pictures: Masks and social distancing at downsized Hajj
item.description: Only about 60,000 pilgrims living in Saudi Arabia were eligible to take part this year.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: What's behind the violence and looting?
item.description: Some analysts say the violence wasn't spontaneous anger but a deliberate strategy of sabotage.

item.title: Under the skin of OnlyFans
item.description: A BBC investigation reveals concerns about how the site, known for porn, is structured and moderated.

item.title: Lions boss Gatland expects 'robust' selection debate for first Test with South Africa
item.description: British and Irish Lions head coach Warren Gatland says he expects a lively discussion about selection for the first Test with South Africa.

item.title: St Helens win Challenge Cup for first time in 13 years - highlights & report
item.description: St Helens come from behind to beat Castleford at Wembley and win the Challenge Cup for the first time in 13 years.

item.title: Pogacar set for Tour de France victory as Van Aert wins penultimate stage
item.description: Tadej Pogacar is set to win the Tour de France after finishing seventh in the time trial on a penultimate stage won by Wout van Aert.

item.title: Jimenez makes long-awaited return and Vieira's Palace win - pre-season round-up
item.description: Raul Jimenez made his long-awaited return from injury as Wolves lost at Crewe, while Palace and Chelsea enjoyed friendly wins

item.title: The Open 2021: Louis Oosthuizen, Collin Morikawa & Jordan Spieth feature in story of day
item.description: Watch highlights as Louis Oosthuizen, Collin Morikawa & Jordan Spieth battle for the top spot on the third day of The Open 2021 at Royal St. George's.

item.title: Challenge Cup final: Castleford Tigers 12-26 St Helens
item.description: Watch highlights as St Helens come from behind to beat Castleford Tigers 26-12 and win the Challenge Cup for the first time in 13 years.

item.title: The Open 2021: Jazz Janewattananond hits creative bunker shot
item.description: Thailand's Jazz Janewattananond hits a creative bunker shot on his knees on the third day at The Open 2021 at Royal St. George's.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England could have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Amber list: 'I'm going to Ibiza by any means necessary'
item.description: The Balearic Islands joining the amber travel list for England is causing a dilemma for some holiday makers.

item.title: Covid: What will mask makers do now?
item.description: People around the country have made and sold masks during the pandemic. Here's what they'll do next.

item.title: Snail mail: Postcard sent in 1989 finally delivered
item.description: Andrew Leslie's message to his dad, sent from Michigan in 1989, finally reaches his Grimsby home.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.
